org.mundo.util
Class DirectoryWalker

java.lang.Object
  org.mundo.util.DirectoryWalker
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Iterable<java.io.File>
public class DirectoryWalker
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Iterable<java.io.File>

A DirectoryWalker iterates over all of the files of a directory and its subdirectories. The DirectoryWalker is aware of symbolic links and of recursions that may result from them. Walking will start at given directory and is breadth first. Calls to the remove method of the Walker will be mapped to a delete for the file. The iterators of a DirectoryWalker are not fail-fast - the directories may be modified during the runtime of the DirectoryWalker without detecting that.

Author:
AHa

DirectoryWalker

public DirectoryWalker(java.io.File dir,
                       boolean followsymbolic)
                throws java.io.IOException
Initializes a new directory walker for a given directory. If the dir parameter does not point to a directory at the time the Walker's iterator method is called, then the Walker constructed will stop imediately.

Parameters:
dir - the directory to walk through.
followsymbolic - true if symbolic links should be followed, false otherwise
Throws:
java.io.IOException
